summary: An FBI Crisis Intake report documenting a call from a federal corrections officer at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The officer reports witnessing suspicious shredding of large amounts of documents by a Bureau of Prisons After-Actions team in the days following Jeffrey Epstein's death by hanging. The officer expresses concern about the shredding occurring during an active investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document states that Epstein hung himself in his cell at MCC the previous week, and the reported shredding activity is occurring in the aftermath of his death during an ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Unnamed Federal Corrections Officer
persons.context: A corrections officer at MCC New York who called the FBI to report misconduct. He witnessed a BOP After-Actions team shredding large quantities of documents and an inmate being compelled to assist with the shredding and disposal.

persons.name: Unnamed Inmate
persons.context: An inmate from the same unit as Epstein who was reportedly instructed by the After-Actions team to help shred documents and dispose of the bags in a dumpster. He expressed reluctance but felt compelled to comply.

persons.name: Unnamed BOP Staff Member
persons.context: A member of the Bureau of Prisons After-Actions team who, according to the reporting officer, was overseeing the shredding operation and instructed the inmate to ensure all material was shredded, stating 'this isn't the first time I've had to do things like this.'

connections.description: The corrections officer witnessed the inmate being instructed by the BOP team to help shred documents and dispose of them, and spoke with the inmate about the activity.
The BOP staff member gave instructions to the inmate to assist with shredding documents and disposing of them, with the inmate feeling he could not refuse.
The inmate was reportedly from the same unit in the MCC as Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FBI Crisis Intake Call Regarding MCC Shredding
events.description: A federal corrections officer at MCC New York calls the FBI National Threat Operations Center to report that a BOP After-Actions team is shredding huge amounts of paperwork in the days following Epstein's death.

events.title: Initial Shredding Incident at MCC
events.description: The reporting officer first observes the BOP After-Actions team shredding documents and an inmate being instructed to help dispose of 4-5 bags of shredded material into a dumpster.

events.title: Continued Shredding at MCC
events.description: On the day of the FBI call, the inmate is again involved in shredding activities, bringing another bag of shredded materials to the dumpster.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: The document references that 'Last week Epstein hung himself,' indicating his death occurred in the MCC cell approximately the week prior to August 16, 2019.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A federal corrections officer reported suspicious, large-scale shredding of documents by a Bureau of Prisons After-Actions team at MCC New York in the immediate aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The shredding was witnessed on August 15 and 16, 2019, with an inmate from Epstein's unit being compelled to assist in disposing of 4-5 bags of shredded material into a dumpster.
A BOP staff member overseeing the shredding told the inmate, 'this isn't the first time I've had to do things like this,' suggesting a pattern of similar conduct.

The reporting officer found it highly suspicious that an official investigative team would be destroying paperwork while other agencies (AIG, FBI, BOP) were present in the building conducting an investigation.
The dumpster containing the shredded documents was scheduled for routine pickup on the Monday following the report, creating a narrow timeframe for recovery.
